availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: George Washington Craddock (Hart Count, Kentucky attorney)

body.p: Born on June 7, 1814 in Hart County, Kentucky. Attorney. Appointed Deputy Clerk of the County and Circuits Courts of Hart County in 1830. Licensed to practice law in 1835. Elected to Lower House of General Assembly in 1840. Re-elected in 1841. Entered into partnership in James Harlan in 1842. Owned the Democratic paper the Kentucky Yeoman during the Civil War. Married Mary T. Murray on April 22, 1835. Died in 1839 leaving one child, Charles. Married a second time to Harriet W. Theobald. Five children.

bibl.p: J.M. Armstrong, The Biographical Encyclopedia of Kentucky of the Dead and Living Men of the Nineteenth Century (Cincinnati: J.M. Armstrong & Co.), 88-90.
